Master
Class ObjectRecognition

java.lang.Object
  Master.ObjectRecognition

public class ObjectRecognition
extends java.lang.Object

Class to recognize whether a block is a blue block or not First, you should calibrate the blue block's color by calling the calibrateBlueBlock() method. If you don't, then it won't consider anything to be a blue block. Then you can call checkColor() to verify if an object is blue or not. Objects that aren't bright enough will be rejected, so closer blue blocks have more chances or being recognized as blue block.

Author:
Nick

Method Detail

checkDistance

public int checkDistance()
Check the distance from the sensor to the object, may lead to signal being sent back to master to reposition robot in front of the block

Returns:
The distance from the sensor to the object

checkColor

public java.lang.Boolean checkColor()
Checks the color of the object

Returns:
True if the object is a blue block, false otherwise

calibrateBlueBlock

public void calibrateBlueBlock()
Prompts the user to perform a calibration of the blue block's color. This will obtain multiple samples of the blue color and retain the average.
